instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
Clean board overall, had some small corrosion near C3208 and R3203, after cleaning the area and reflowing CD3215 same problem, only 5.2v and 0.02a taken.

I then replaced first the CD3215 that was next to the corrosion and same thing, then replaced the other CD3215 and same thing, those were purchased from Rossmann I sure there are good and both are the C00 ones.

No shorts, but PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC and PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC are both 0 volts, I connected the charger in all 4 ways, diode mode to ground on those lines are 0.496 and 0.512.

F30000 and F3010 are both fine.

I also checked redriver and looked fine, but removed it to test anyways but same problem, I am still learning about this USB-C boards and I am having a hard time with them.

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
Post 3V3_G3H and R7020 voltages.
Also check TBA_AUX_DET, TBA_VDDA/P, SMC_RESET_L and BUF_SMC_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]3V3_G3H 3.4v
R7020 5.2v
TBA_AUX_DET 1.3v
TBA_VDDA 5.1v
TBA_VDDP 5.1v
SMC_RESET_L  3.4v
BUF_SMC_RESET_L.  3.4v[/FONT][/COLOR]

[/LEFT]

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
I had 00840/00875 boards where I got 1.1V LDO output only from one CD3215.
Sometime I did a trick on the port with missing voltage and it worked; but never worked when both chips missed 1.1V LDO.
I suppose you still have a problem with USB-C area; maybe corrosion around U2800/90.

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
U2800 looks perfect, I checked for shorts and bad resistors around it and found nothing.
U2890 I tried a different one from a -01 board but no luck.

I just also tried 2 new CD3215 and nothing either.

I wonder if [USER="637"]TCRScircuit[/USER] can give us some tips.

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
Put back original U2890; make backup dump first.
Can you see any activity on its pins, with o-scope?

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message: following.. still havent figured this out either

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message: I have this exact problem.. No solution so far

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message: OK, just wanted to let you know i have resolved all of these with a missing BMC LDO by replacing the TBT ROM (U2890 on a 00840 board). In all of them, the BMC LDOs came back and i got 20v back.

threads.title: 820-00840 5v on both ports, 0v on PP1V1_UPC_X/A/B_LDO_BMC
threads.message:
Thanks for mention.
Did you make a backup of working ROM?
Flashing original chip should be sufficient in such case...
